title: US Connection Issues to RIOT Servers (ISSUE FOUND)
body:
EDIT: 20 Aug 2015

I see a lot of people posting their trace routes everyday. Please look at the RIOT responses in this discussion. I no longer experience the same connection issue I posted here weeks ago. I believe this issue is resolved.

tldr I deleted the original post and instructions because I believe THIS issue was resolved. Your current issue is probably not related.

Servers are moving soon so keep that in mind. The light at the end of the   tunnel draws near.

replies.body:
Hey everyone! 

We're looking into a possible issue with Comcast now - thanks for your reports! Please keep them coming.

Will update the boards as more information comes to light.

whats the deal... its been over 4 hours since you identified it and this problem has been happening since last night. i personally have only witnessed it getting worse. last night i had random lag spikes and today i cant even get into a game without my connection to your servers dropping. this is super whack...{{item:3070}}

> [{quoted}](name=The KS Master,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=T9RWEWIW,comment-id=000400090000,timestamp=2015-08-06T02:56:25.670+0000)
>
> Frankly it's pathetic...

"We'll keep you posted" -Riot 
.... famous last words.

more like..
"We'll keep you posted" - Comcast to Riot

Location: Denver, CO
ISP: Comcast

Thank you for the quick response. I hope our tracerts help resolve this issue faster!
PLEASEEE is there anything that i can do to fix this for a short amount of time, i have Comcast and the packet loss/ packet buffering is unbearable.

> [{quoted}](name=iHolloW Avenge7,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=T9RWEWIW,comment-id=00040006,timestamp=2015-08-06T01:43:10.197+0000)
>
> PLEASEEE is there anything that i can do to fix this for a short amount of time, i have Comcast and the packet loss/ packet buffering is unbearable.

Absolutely. Firstly though remember:
1. Never try to fix League on a hill.
2. Make sure you have a lot of room so you don’t run into anything.
3. Spin around in clockwise circles.
4. Make up your own League chant.  It should be rhythmical
and easy to say fast.
5. Yell your League chant while spinning around in circles.
6. If you are trying to get rid of your connection to League, spin in counterclockwise circles and say your chant backward.

(Adapted from a guide to preforming a  rain dance)

Hey so I know its only been like 2.5 hours and there very well might not be new info, but could we get an update even if its just to say "nothing new, sorry?"

My insecurities want you to confirm that you are still working on this

It's been four hours *since the last update*, any idea what is going on?

edit: added **

Hi all,


A bit of background - as part of our Riot NA Roadmap, we've brought our Denver location online, with a direct peering port to Comcast in this location. This is why you may have noticed your latency drop if you're in the surrounding region.

We believe we've identified a problem affecting this new port - we've been passing your traceroutes along with our own to Comcast to help them diagnose.

Apologies for the problems! We will get this fixed.
Does that mean the once this is all resolved the lower ping will be permanent?

> [{quoted}](name=Protanopia,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=T9RWEWIW,comment-id=009d0000,timestamp=2015-08-06T05:39:51.510+0000)
>
> Does that mean the once this is all resolved the lower ping will be permanent?

Correct!
So anyone in CO recently have their ping drastically lowered? Mine went from 72 to 44 in game and thats when all this packet loss started happening
Yup, I'm in Downtown Denver (Comcast ISP), ping normally 70. Was 44 today, but I was obviously experiencing same issues as everyone else. Tracert inc.
yeh im from littleton CO and this started happening yesterday for me, thought oh cool my ping is lower but i keep disconnecting lol

For those of you who aren't able to login - please try and run a trace to 192.64.174.65 instead. 

This will be a different issue to the Comcast one -- we are looking in to it.
Hi, Lafayette Louisiana here, on LUS Fiber. Can't log into the game at all stuck on "logging in" until it tells me the connection has failed

>

Hey Summoners!

**Quickly regarding Comcast surrounding CO - seeing conflicting reports that game is OK, others that the problem is back again. Continuing to investigate with Comcast, and we'll be keeping a very close eye coming up towards peak time this afternoon to see if performance drops.**

---

We were focusing on the large number of reports of problems with Comcast traffic entering Denver last night, and the majority of this thread I will keep scoped to this problem.

I'm noticing many new traceroutes from players being posted that are not related specifically to this scope (I can see CA, VA, CT Comcast traces, as well as some other ISPs).

I promise these aren't being ignored - though it does take us a little longer to work through the increasing number of posts containing technical information unrelated to this specific Comcast/Denver issue.

We will be following up on any information you post here and in other threads to try and find problems we can fix, but it would make us Ritos with our Heimer wrenches task much easier, if, when posting your traceroutes or logs, you can **specify what City/State you're playing from** at the beginning of your post. [e] - Please also tell us what symptoms you're experiencing. (Stuttering gameplay/Firewall error/Unable to log-in/Disconnected from PVP.net)

If we're able to identify a growing number of posts pointing to a common location/area/ISP, we'll make new stickied threads asking for info from the group of affected players (like I probably should have done here).

Please continue to keep us updated - the more we know, the quicker we'll get things fixed!

I find it hard to take serious that Riot is taking this serious while still issuing Leaver Buster punishment to those suffering through this bug. Also, this has been an issue for some since patch 5.14 and Riot has had no response until yesterday? And it's not just CO, I'm in Chicago having this issue but I am a Comcast customer.

Im not sure what you are asking of Riot. They are now working on the issue and you are still complaining. He did say in this thread that most of the problems with this particular topic are for people in Colorado.

What am I asking? For starters, they can suspend Leaver Buster until the issue has been resolved. It's not complaining, it's stating the facts. How much does Riot pay you to defend them against legitimate questions? Again, this has been an issue since patch 5.14 came out and Riot had nothing to say about it until now. Don't be Riot's puppy.

Firstly im not being Riots puppy, im one of the first to criticise them especially in light of the recent comments they have made. They cannot just suspend the Leaver Buster for everyone because a minority have an issue with connection. The fact that you know about the issue should make you not want to play games untill you know the issue has been fixed. Its not the end of the world that you are unable to play a free to play game for a short amount of time.

It's free to play for YOU... myself and others like myself support Riot by actually purchasing products (skins, champs, rune pages). And it hasn't been a short amount of time; this has been going on since the release of 5.14 and Riot turned a blind-eye until just yesterday. You're sure going out of your way to defend them as someone who is "one of the first to criticize them". Do they pay you in money or champion skins?
I do pay for champions and skins actually. This particular issue has only started in the past couple of days. The issue you are having is probably something different.

Hi Folks,

We have managed to work with Comcast and identify the root cause of the issue. Unfortunately it means we need to turn down this location for a couple of days while they repair some capacity. This means that pings will go back up to what they were a week ago while repairs are done but should be down at the lower value and running smoothly by early next week.
I can't even login...

So would you advise  summoners that are having this issue stay away from LoL for a while or does Riot plan to lessen the grip of LeaverBuster? Sitting in a 20 minute queue due to no fault of my own doesn't seem like what LeaverBuster was intended for.

> [{quoted}](name=Kainaan Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=T9RWEWIW,comment-id=00e70003,timestamp=2015-08-07T18:42:10.194+0000)
>
> So would you advise  summoners that are having this issue stay away from LoL for a while or does Riot plan to lessen the grip of LeaverBuster? Sitting in a 20 minute queue due to no fault of my own doesn't seem like what LeaverBuster was intended for.

Your connection looks fine. I think a large part of the problem here is everyone assuming there is a single over-arching issue impacting them when the reality is that there are several discrete ones. Comcast in Colorado is the largest single problem and has forced us to turn down our interconnect with them in that location while they perform repairs and upgrades. The other regions (Virginia for example) look at lot more like local access congestion (peak time lag spikes and packet loss). This type of issue hits services like Netflix etc a lot less as that content can be cached and served to a subscriber from a closer point in the network. The nature of LoL is that it is an interactive real-time game where the server you and 9 other players are on has to be able to talk to you all.

Hey Summoners,

We identified a new issue with our Denver Comcast port around 1:20pm Pacific time - we're working closely with Comcast to get this resolved before the evening.

More to come, stay posted.

Hey Summoners,

We've been making some adjustments along with Comcast to try and solve these issues - can affected players via Comcast Denver test and send in their traces?

Thanks!

Hey guys,

Can you please provide your most recent NetLogs?

They can be found in X:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Logs\Network Logs where "X" is the drive where you installed League of Legends.

Please post them here. 

Thanks for your help!

Post how many, exactly?  Because I have 56 separate TXT documents in that folder.  Want 'em all?

Also, just sayin', are we still trying to diagnose this issue?  Every single tracert in this thread ends at the same IP: 104.160.128.etc.  Even the people who DON'T live in Colorado are being routed through Colorado and this one single IP  which is continually failing.  Who are they?  Talk to those folks.  How is this hard?

> [{quoted}](name=GentleZacharias,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=T9RWEWIW,comment-id=00990001,timestamp=2015-08-06T05:36:47.626+0000)
>
> Post how many, exactly?  Because I have 56 separate TXT documents in that folder.  Want 'em all?
> 
> Also, just sayin', are we still trying to diagnose this issue?  Every single tracert in this thread ends at the same IP: 104.160.128.etc.  Even the people who DON'T live in Colorado are being routed through Colorado and this one single IP  which is continually failing.  Who are they?  Talk to those folks.  How is this hard?

The end is not what I am interested in in this circumstance - it's the path through Comcast's network before it hits our network that is the vital part for troubleshooting. The worst information is no information :)

Can anyone else confirm if their issues have subsided? Still no official word from Comcast, but I am unable to replicate the issues I was able to see from our Denver routers when I first jumped into the thread.

Will keep chasing Comcast for some answers.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Foro,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=T9RWEWIW,comment-id=00a4,timestamp=2015-08-06T05:35:25.108+0000)
>
> Can anyone else confirm if their issues have subsided? Still no official word from Comcast, but I am unable to replicate the issues I was able to see from our Denver routers when I first jumped into the thread.
> 
> Will keep chasing Comcast for some answers.

I can confirm the issues have subsided, but Foro I've noticed this being a problem occuring only around 4-8PM Central since it has started, it hasn't really remained consistent.

Hello fellow Summoners and staff of Riot Games,

First off, please stop giving all this hate to Riot. They're doing their best to help everyone they can, and also, all the hate that's going out to them is unnecessary because in the end it wont help anyone. Second, after I had logged back into LoL to check up on the status, I was able to play again! This ultimately means that Riot is trying very hard to get this dealt with. For those who are still not able to play, I'm sorry but you still need to be patient. I get that it sucks trust me this is happened to me and I even dropped a division, but we just need to forgive and forget.

Also, thanks to @TraakSC for making this thread and spreading the word about this problem! Without you, Riot Games might have not even been able to notice this problem and it probably wouldn't be getting fixed. So thanks so much!

Enjoy your night guys, 
   Swadzeh :P
